body_html:
This question is better asked on StackOverflow since it is not a bug or feature request. There is also a larger community that reads questions there. Thanks!

But since you told me stackoverflow doesn't work, it seems like a normal variable would be sufficient for your purposes. There aren't transient activation records like an imperative language where auto allocated and instantiated variables are created and destroyed with function overheads. Please read the documentation to get a feeling for how graph base computation works.

body:
This question is better asked on  [StackOverflow](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/tensorflow) since it is not a  bug or feature request. There is also a larger community that reads questions there. Thanks!

But since you told me stackoverflow doesn't work, it seems like  a normal variable would be sufficient for your purposes. There aren't transient activation records like an imperative language where auto allocated and instantiated variables are created and destroyed with function overheads. Please read the documentation to get a feeling for how graph base computation works.
